full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 759 Filed 08/10/22 Page 30 of 267 2058 LCACmax1 A. Farmer - direct with him at his home. He was very -- he seemed very friendly and kind of down to earth, he was dressed casually. We were dressed up because we were going to the theater and this was a big deal because I had been very excited about seeing this production, and he invited us into his home and we talked and served us champagne. And then, later on, his driver took us to the play. Q. Just to unpack that a little bit. Where did you meet Epstein? A. At his home. Q. Can you describe for the jury what the home looked like. A. Yeah, it was a very grand home. I was staying with my sister in her apartment, which is about, I think, 500 square feet. So I had never been in a private residence that was so large in the city before. It was full of very nice things. I remember sitting across a desk from him, like, you know, a beautiful large wooden desk in this kind of library room. And, yeah, it was just a very, you know, a very fancy home. THE COURT: Ms. Farmer, could I ask you to move the microphone a little bit closer to you if you speak directly into it. THE WITNESS: Yes. Sorry. THE COURT: Thank you. Q. What, if anything, did Epstein ask you about? A. Well, one thing he asked me about was my plans for after SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00016246

text_blocks.content: with him at his home. He was very -- he seemed very friendly and kind of down to earth, he was dressed casually. We were dressed up because we were going to the theater and this was a big deal because I had been very excited about seeing this production, and he invited us into his home and we talked and served us champagne. And then, later on, his driver took us to the play.
Q. Just to unpack that a little bit. Where did you meet Epstein?
Q. Can you describe for the jury what the home looked like.

A. Yeah, it was a very grand home. I was staying with my sister in her apartment, which is about, I think, 500 square feet. So I had never been in a private residence that was so large in the city before. It was full of very nice things. I remember sitting across a desk from him, like, you know, a beautiful large wooden desk in this kind of library room. And, yeah, it was just a very, you know, a very fancy home.
THE COURT: Ms. Farmer, could I ask you to move the microphone a little bit closer to you if you speak directly into it.
Q. What, if anything, did Epstein ask you about?
A. Well, one thing he asked me about was my plans for after
